snippet: Newly released messages between administration officials and drug industry lobbyists underscore the compromises underlying President Obama’s effort to overhaul health care.
abstract: Batches of e-mail messages and other documents obtained and released by House Republicans offer a window into the compromises struck between the Obama administration and the pharmaceutical industry as the administration pursued its health care overhaul; deal-making, which largely took place in 2009, represents a pivotal moment in which Obama first came to grips with the messy reality of Washington policy-making.
lead_paragraph: Newly released messages between administration officials and drug industry lobbyists underscore the compromises underlying President Obama’s effort to overhaul health care.

headline.seo: E-Mails Highlight Extent of Obama’s Deal With Industry on Health Care
headline.main: Obama Was Pushed by Drug Industry, E-Mails Suggest
headline.print_headline: Obama Pushed By Drug Lobby, E-Mails Suggest
